S

sendCommand(String) - Method in class chat.ClientCode
sends a command to the server not meant to be sent to other clients!
sendMessage(String) - Method in class chat.ClientCode
Sends a message to the server.
server - Class in chat
The class containing the gui for the server and the main class to launch it Creates a new ServerCode object when start is pressed
server() - Constructor for class chat.server
Creates new form server
ServerCode - Class in chat
The class which holds all of the relevant variables and objects to the server Opens a server socket and start a Thread using SetConnection class to listen to client trying to connect
ServerCode(JTextArea) - Constructor for class chat.ServerCode
constructor
SetConnection - Class in chat
This class is used as a Thread to listen to clients trying to connect to the server on the server socket we opened.
SetConnection(JTextArea, Socket, ServerSocket, ObjectOutputStream, ObjectInputStream, ArrayList<ClientHolder>) - Constructor for class chat.SetConnection
Constructor
setName(String) - Method in class chat.ClientHolder

setOutput(ObjectOutputStream) - Method in class chat.ClientHolder
Sets the output stream
showMessage(String) - Method in class chat.ClientCode
Update chat window.
start() - Method in class chat.server
 
startRunning() - Method in class chat.ClientCode
Starts the client running Once the socket and streams are set up, creates a Thread using the ClientLister class to listen to messages from the server
startRunning() - Method in class chat.ServerCode
This method starts the server SetConnection Thread is created to listen to clients trying to connect another Thread is created inside SetConnection to listen to every client's messages
